comment: Best professor EVER. Makes it known he wants everyone to pass. He will tell you EVERYTHING you need to know for tests so it's just studying. He is very understanding of reasons you struggle/may miss class. You leave class with SO much knowledge and an easy A. TAKE HIM IF YOU HAVE THE CHANCE!!

Prof Jolis can be rude and condescending. However, if you attend all of his classes and tastings you should pass all the tests. There is a group project and a two restaurant reports. This class has tons of work but super easy. Ignore professor if you have to because you learn about many foods and spices.

World Cuisines was the easiest & most fun class I've ever taken. Chef (Professor Jolis) is chill & doesn't make anything harder than it needs to be. Easy A for sure, but make sure to come to class because you'll lose points for each absence - excused or unexcused. I had to miss one class for a funeral, I told him prior to it, & I still lost points.

Easy class, great professor. Attendance, tasting quizzes, restaurant reports (3 pages), group presentation (which includes a 5-page paper and 12 minute powerpoint), and tasting journal are the main grades. There's a final and a midterm, but they're not hard. Some of the assignments seem mediocre but it's an easy A so do it for your GPA.

Great professor - absolutely there to teach. Weekly tastings, journals, quizzes - attendance is a must. 2 Restaurant reports (3 pages), 1 project (5 pages plus presentation), weekly journal (1-2 pages), 10-15 question weekly quiz, 60 question midterm. Knows his job and is dedicated to being a professional and helping students succeed.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He can come off condescending but if you have that certain personality press him about it. Overall, good course, laid back lectures, easy quizzes and exams. I suggest getting the book just to explore more, some of the dishes you're going to want to recreate. 1 thing, he speaks a lot about Christopher Columbus... i'll leave it at that. Challenge it.
I wish the school will give him more classes to teach, because he is really the best teacher I think I have ever had at KSU. Take him and you will learn a lot, and have fun at the same time. :)

Chef Jolis has got to be the most laid back professor I have ever had. He loves telling stories about his life, and they're really interesting; this guy has done a lot in this life. You eat food from different regions and write 1 page journals. Quizzes sometimes. Gives you all the test questions before the midterm and final. He's a wonderful guy.

Chef Jolis is the most laid back professor I've ever had. He wants you to learn about the food and is passionate about fishing! He loves sharing stories and assigns a weekly journal. Keep up with it and you'll be fine. Easy A and most interesting at that! Btw you don't ever use the textbook. Don't bother buying it.

Favorite professor I have ever had! He makes the class enjoyable and "easy" by providing the useful notes that correspond with what you are being tested on. No tricks, he wants you to do well. Love, love, love him! I wish he taught more classes. Highly recommended! His class notes make the textbook useless. Literally didn't open it once.
